definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: And the waters prevailed exceedingly upon the earth； and all the high hills， that were under the whole heaven， were covered.
sentences.chinese: 水势在地上极其浩大，天下的高山都淹没了。

sentences.english: We are met on a great battle field of that war.
sentences.chinese: 吾等现相逢于此战中一处浩大战场。

sentences.english: This election's going to be huge.
sentences.chinese: 这次大选的声势将非常浩大。

sentences.english: They made a gigantic [huge; mammoth] demonstration against the government.
sentences.chinese: 他们举行了一次声势浩大的反政府示威。

sentences.english: The ride was momentous, historical, and calm.
sentences.chinese: 这次乘车声势浩大，是历史性的，而且异常沉稳。

sentences.english: Why do Chinese people hold memorial ceremonies for them every year?
sentences.chinese: 为什么中国人对黄帝声势浩大的祭典历久不衰？

sentences.english: Shanxi coal mine massive mergers and acquisitions in real terms in step by step movement.
sentences.chinese: 声势浩大的山西煤矿兼并重组运动迈出实质一步。

sentences.english: They rose greatly on the earth, and all the high mountains under the entire heavens were covered.
sentences.chinese: 水势在地上极其浩大，天下的高山都淹没了。

sentences.english: A project of this scale is a team effort.
sentences.chinese: 写作论文工程浩大，需要团队共同努力才能完成。

sentences.english: The scandal shut off his high-powered election campaign.
sentences.chinese: 这件丑闻终止了他那声势浩大的竞选运动。

sentences.english: Queen Latifah and Jay Leno round out this all-star cast.
sentences.chinese: 杰？雷诺的加入使这份明星卡司声势更为浩大。

sentences.english: The mammoth size of village levies has historically been one of the major symptoms of maladministration.
sentences.chinese: 历史上最大的病政之一，是村款的浩大。

sentences.english: For a time our team hesitated before the immensity of this task.
sentences.chinese: 这支队伍面对这项浩大的工程犹豫了一个时期。

sentences.english: The construction lasted several years and cost a large sum of money.
sentences.chinese: 由于工程浩大，持续了数年，耗资万金。

definition: vast and mighty (of river or ocean)/broad and powerful
